profile.name: Rohan Ghosh
profile.bio: Passionate full-stack developer with expertise in building scalable web applications. I transform ideas into elegant solutions.

projects.title: Fujn Global
projects.description: Worked on the Node.js backend for Fujn, building and optimizing APIs to support the platform's web and mobile applications, ensuring scalability, security, and seamless functionality.

projects.title: SportConn
projects.description: Contributed as a full-stack developer, working with Next.js for the frontend and Node.js for the backend. Built and optimized features for a seamless user experience, including dynamic content rendering, API integration, and performance enhancements.

projects.title: Instagram clone
projects.description: Independently developed an Instagram clone using Next.js and MongoDB. Implemented features such as user authentication, image uploads, posts, likes, and comments, providing a seamless and responsive user experience.

experience.description: During my internship, I gained hands-on experience with JavaScript and React, learning the fundamentals of building dynamic and responsive user interfaces. I also enhanced my problem-solving skills by practicing data structures and algorithms (DSA), which helped me understand efficient coding practices and optimize application performance. This experience laid a strong foundation for my career in web development.

Over the past two years, I have gained extensive experience as a full-stack developer, working on dynamic and scalable web applications. At Fujn, I developed robust Node.js backend services, ensuring seamless integration for both web and mobile platforms. I independently built an Instagram clone using Next.js and MongoDB, implementing features like authentication, image uploads, posts, likes, and comments to provide a smooth user experience. Additionally, I contributed to SportConn as a full-stack developer, utilizing Next.js for the frontend and Node.js for the backend to deliver high-performance and user-friendly solutions.
